statement: The research plan presents detailed training specifications including batch sizes, learning rates, warm-up phases, and UNet2DModel configurations with ResNet layers and attention mechanisms.
The proposed data preprocessing procedure for detection and alignment of floor plans from the comprehensive 12,000 image dataset is carefully designed.

There is limited novelty in the application of diffusion models to architectural floor plan generation, as there is ample prior work using diffusion models for architectural floor plan generation and other kinds of layout generation.

The research plan does not propose a novel methodology but rather describes standard processes including image processing, UNet architecture implementation, training procedures, data augmentation, and post-processing techniques like upscaling.
The technical innovation in the proposed approach is quite insufficient, and the introduction to the U-Net architecture is entirely superfluous.
The proposed dataset focusing only on residential floor plans is quite limited and would benefit from introducing more types of architectural styles and layouts.
